cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving NNW today, expected to turn north then N-NE on Thursday, skirting the coasts of GA/SC/NC, then accelerating northeastward just offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South Carolina or extreme southeast North Carolina (near Cape Fear)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North Carolina/Virginia border to Chincoteague VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Volusia/Brevard County FL line to Surf City NC; Tropical Storm Warning Sebastian Inlet FL to Savannah River GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast through Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina and southeastern Virginia coasts
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (NHC guidance 2–4 ft for Hampton Roads)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with gusts over 50 kt possible Friday, small chance of hurricane-force gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in Hampton Roads and lower Chesapeake Bay during high tide Friday
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain expected Thursday night–Friday with localized flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and a low tornado risk in outer rain bands
